intro: Rosularia adenotricha, commonly known as the woolly rosebay, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and dense covering of soft, woolly hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid climates. Rosularia adenotricha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
